We need relationship between Jordan and Amanda.

We have Jordan appears in statement 20: George -> Jordan (George ancestor of Jordan). Also maybe elsewhere? Not else.

Amanda appears in statement 42: Amanda -> Kevin (Amanda ancestor of Kevin). Also maybe elsewhere? Not else.

We need to see if there is any path connecting Jordan and Amanda via ancestor/descendant relationships.

We need to see if Jordan is ancestor/descendant of Amanda, or they share common ancestor/descendant.

Let's build ancestry chains.

First, find ancestors of Jordan: George is ancestor of Jordan. Also any ancestors of George? From statement 1: Janet -> George (Janet ancestor of George). Also from statement 14: Jennifer -> Janet. So chain: Jennifer -> Janet -> George -> Jordan. Also any other ancestors of Janet? Not else. So ancestors of Jordan include: Janet, George, Jennifer, plus maybe further up? Not.

Also any other ancestors of George? Not else.

Thus Jordan's ancestors: George, Janet, Jennifer.

Now descendants of Jordan? Any statements where Jordan is ancestor of someone else? Not directly. Could be via chain: If someone is descendant of Jordan via other statements? Not given.

Now Amanda's ancestors: Who is ancestor of Amanda? From statement 42: Amanda -> Kevin, so Kevin is descendant. So ancestors of Amanda are those who are ancestors of Amanda? Not given. But we have Kevin is descendant of Amanda, and Kevin is descendant of? Actually statement 11: Kevin -> Albert? Wait statement 11: Albert is Kevin's descendant => Kevin -> Albert (Kevin ancestor of Albert). So chain: Amanda -> Kevin -> Albert. Also Albert -> Eric (Albert ancestor of Eric) from 31? Actually 31: Eric is Albert's descendant => Albert -> Eric. So chain continues: Amanda -> Kevin -> Albert -> Eric. Also Eric -> Justin (47: Eric -> Justin). So Amanda -> Kevin -> Albert -> Eric -> Justin. Also Justin -> Heather (56: Justin -> Heather). So Amanda -> ... -> Heather. Also Heather -> Arthur? Wait statement 5: Arthur is Heather's descendant => Heather -> Arthur. So chain: Amanda -> ... -> Heather -> Arthur. Then Arthur -> Lisa (32: Arthur -> Lisa). Also Lisa -> Isabella (44: Lisa -> Isabella). Also Isabella -> Lori (21: Isabella -> Lori). Also Lori -> Cynthia (34: Lori -> Cynthia). Also Cynthia -> Frances (6: Cynthia -> Frances). Frances -> Margaret (18). Margaret -> Mary (49). Mary -> Matthew (53). Matthew -> Brandon (50). Brandon -> Zachary (62). Zachary -> Laura (40). Laura -> Charlotte (41). Charlotte -> Scott (52). Scott -> Rachel (23). Rachel -> Nicole (2). Nicole -> Gabriel (43). Gabriel -> Charles (3 reversed? Actually 3: Charles is Gabriel's descendant => Gabriel -> Charles). So chain continues.

Thus Amanda is ancestor of many.

Now does Jordan appear anywhere in that chain? Let's see if Jordan is descendant of someone who is descendant of Amanda? Or ancestor of someone who is ancestor of Amanda? Let's see.

We have Jordan's ancestors: George, Janet, Jennifer. Are any of those in Amanda's descendant chain? Not obviously.

Check if Jordan is descendant of someone who is descendant of Amanda: For Jordan to be descendant of Amanda, there must be a path Amanda -> ... -> Jordan. Let's see if any chain from Amanda leads to Jordan. Starting from Amanda -> Kevin -> Albert -> Eric -> Justin -> Heather -> Arthur -> Lisa -> Isabella -> Lori -> Cynthia -> Frances -> Margaret -> Mary -> Matthew -> Brandon -> Zachary -> Laura -> Charlotte -> Scott -> Rachel -> Nicole -> Gabriel -> Charles? Wait after Charles? Charles is descendant of Gabriel, but we have Charles -> Brenda (4) and Brenda -> Bryan (8) etc. Could that lead to Jordan? Not yet.

Continue chain: After Charles -> Brenda -> Bryan -> Anthony -> Sophia? Actually Anthony -> Sophia (63). Sophia -> Evelyn (60). Evelyn -> Judith (9). Judith -> John (39). John -> Victoria (55). Victoria -> Jacqueline (45). Jacqueline -> Peter (48). Peter -> Jacob (12). Jacob -> Susan (28). Susan -> Nancy (54). Nancy -> Wayne (26). Wayne -> Juan (59). Juan -> Mark (7). Mark -> Kenneth (10). Kenneth -> Bradley (17). Bradley -> Grace (30). Grace -> Christopher (33). Christopher -> Marie (22). Marie -> Hannah (15). Hannah -> Julie (35). Julie -> Timothy (58). Timothy -> Maria (38). Maria -> Jean (16). Jean -> Abigail (29). Abigail -> Stephanie (46). Stephanie -> Patrick (27). Patrick -> Deborah (24). Deborah -> Logan (19). Logan -> Amber (51). Amber -> Joshua (13). Joshua -> Danielle (25). Danielle -> Henry (57). Henry -> Carolyn (36). Carolyn -> Jennifer (61). Jennifer -> Janet (14). Janet -> George (1). George -> Jordan (20). Wow! This is a long chain that indeed leads to Jordan.

Thus there is a path from Amanda to Jordan via many steps. Therefore Jordan is a descendant of Amanda. So relationship: Jordan is Amanda's descendant. That matches answer 2.

Check if any alternative like common ancestor? But we have direct ancestor relationship, so answer 2.

Thus outputANSWER>2ANSWER>.
